revisions.rev:
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2010}} {{Infobox model | name = Brooklyn Decker | image = BrooklynDeckerJun09.jpg | caption = Decker in June 2009 | residence = [[North Carolina]] | birth_name = Brooklyn Danielle Decker | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1987|4|12}} | birth_place = [[Kettering, Ohio|Kettering]], Ohio, U.S. | yearsactive = 2006âpresent | height = {{height|ft=5|in=9}} | haircolor = Blonde | eyecolor = Blue | measurements = 36C-24-34 | spouse = [[Andy Roddick]] (2009âpresent) | agency = [[Marilyn Agency]] }} '''Brooklyn Danielle Decker'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.heftig-magazin.de/2010/12/09/v2/ |title=V2 | heft|ig magazin |publisher=Heftig-magazin.de |date=2008-10-17 |accessdate=2011-09-23}}</ref> (born April 12, 1987)<ref>{{cite news |url=http://lucire.com/2007/0112ll0.shtml |title=Brooklyn in New York |publisher=Lucire |date=January 12, 2007 |accessdate=January 13, 2007}}</ref> is an American fashion model and actress best known for her appearances in the [[Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue|''Sports Illustrated'' Swimsuit Issue]], including the [[List of Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue cover models|cover]] of the 2010 issue. In addition to working for [[Victoria's Secret]] for the 2010 "Swim" collection, she has ventured into television with guest appearances on ''[[Chuck (TV series)|Chuck]]'', ''[[Ugly Betty]]'' and ''[[Royal Pains]]''. She made her feature film debut in ''[[Just Go with It]]''. Decker is married to American tennis player [[Andy Roddick]].
==Early life== Decker was born in [[Kettering, Ohio]], the daughter of Tessa (nÃ©e Moore), a nurse, and Stephen Decker, a pacemaker seller. She has one brother, Jordan, who is three years younger than her. <ref>{{cite web|author=By Théoden Janes |url=http://www.charlotteobserver.com/2010/02/10/1236286/brooklyn-deckers-biggest-splash.html |title=Brooklyn Decker's biggest splash | CharlotteObserver.com & The Charlotte Observer Newspaper |publisher=Charlotteobserver.com |date=2010-02-10 |accessdate=2011-10-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://cincytv.blogspot.com/2006_02_01_archive.html |title=Television: February 2006 |publisher=Cincytv.blogspot.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.middletownjournal.com/hp/content/oh/story/news/local/2006/12/30/mj123006mccrabbtop10.html |title=Dayton, Ohio, news and information |publisher=MiddletownJournal |date= |accessdate=2011-09-23}}</ref> She and her family moved to [[Middletown, Ohio|Middletown]], Ohio, then to [[Matthews, North Carolina|Matthews]], North Carolina, a suburb of Charlotte. She was discovered in a Charlotte shopping mall as a teenager. Decker began her modeling career as the face of Mauri Simone, a popular prom dress maker. She won the 2003 Model of the Year award at the Connections Model and Talent Convention.<ref name=Askmen>{{cite web|url=http://www.askmen.com/celebs/women/models_300/380_brooklyn_decker.html |title=profile |publisher=Askmen.com |date=1987-08-03 |accessdate=2011-02-17}}</ref> In a January 2011 interview with ''[[Self (magazine)|Self]]'' magazine, Decker stated that she suffered from an [[eating disorder]] and states, "My father did an intervention and got me to stop obsessing about everyone else and wrecking my body."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.babyrazzi.com/2011/01/19/brooklyn-deckers-dad-saved-her-from-eating-disorder/ |title=Brooklyn Decker's Dad Saved Her From Eating Disorder |publisher=BabyRazzi |date= |accessdate=2011-10-24}}</ref>
==Career== [[File:BrooklynDeckerMay2011.jpg|thumb|left|Decker in May 2011]] Decker has been featured in pictorials in ''[[Teen Vogue]]'', ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]'', ''[[FHM]]'', and ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'', and has modeled for [[The Gap, Inc.|The Gap]], [[Intimissimi]] and [[Victoria's Secret]]. She has appeared in music videos for [[Jimmy Buffett]] and the band [[3 Doors Down]]. She is also an avid [[UNC men's basketball|Tar Heel basketball]] and [[Carolina Panthers]] fan.
In 2005, within two months of moving to New York City, Decker auditioned for the [[Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue|''Sports Illustrated'' Swimsuit Edition]], in which she first appeared in 2006.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/features/2006_swimsuit/models/brooklyn_decker.html |title=2006 Swimsuit: Brooklyn Decker |publisher=SI.com |date=February 14, 2006 |accessdate=January 13, 2007}}</ref> She was again featured in the 2007 edition, and hosted the 2007 behind-the-scenes television special. She returned for a third consecutive time in 2008. Decker was chosen cover girl for the 2010 edition, shot on location in the [[Maldives]] islands. In 2007, she had a recurring feature on the CNN/SI website called "She Says, Z Says," along with [[Paul Zimmerman]], discussing [[NFL]] football games of the week. Decker appeared in the 2007 made-for-television ''Lipshitz Saves the World''.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2395937/ IMDb profile]</ref> She worked for a period in Australia. She joined the cast of Sports New York to discuss the 2010 NCAA basketball tournament.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://showhype.com/story/andy_roddick_and_brooklyn_decker_get_engaged/ |title=Andy Roddick and Brooklyn Decker get engaged |publisher=Showhype.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-17}}</ref> In 2008, Decker rang the [[New York Stock Exchange]] bell with other ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'' models.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/fashion/models/bdecker/brooklyndecker/ |title=profile |publisher=Nymag.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-17}}</ref>
Decker is represented by Marilyn Agency.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marilyn-ny.com/index.php#p=women |title=Female models represented by Marilyn Agency |publisher=marilyn-ny.com |date= |accessdate=2011-04-06}}</ref>
Decker made a guest appearance on NBC's ''[[Chuck (TV series)|Chuck]]'', where she played a model applying to be a "Buy More Girl." She made a guest appearance on USA Network's ''[[Royal Pains]]'' on July 30, 2009. Decker played swimsuit model Rachel, while [[Peter Jacobson]] played Alan, her [[nebbish]] husband.<ref>{{cite news | author=Matt Mitovich | title=Exclusive: House Doc and Swimsuit Model Feel the Pains | url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Jacobson-Decker-Pains-1007206.aspx | work=TV Guide Online | date=June 23, 2009 | accessdate=June 24, 2009}}</ref>
On February 8, 2010, David Letterman announced on ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'' that Decker had been chosen as the 2010 ''Sports Illustrated'' Swimsuit covermodel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/02/08/brooklyn-decker-si-swimsu_n_454070.html |title=Brooklyn Decker SI Swimsuit Issue Cover PHOTO REVEALED |publisher=Huffingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-17}}</ref> Calling her selection "the news of a lifetime," Decker admitted that her mother cried when she heard her daughter would grace the cover.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nationalledger.com/artman/publish/article_272630335.shtml|title=Brooklyn Decker (Photos) Mom Cried Over SI Swimsuit Cover|work=National Ledger|date=Feb 10, 2010|accessdate=Feb 10, 2010}}</ref>
Decker served as a guest judge in the [[Germany's Next Topmodel, Cycle 5|5th]] cycle from ''[[Germany's Next Topmodel]]''.
She was reportedly considered for the lead female role in ''[[Transformers: Dark of the Moon]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Fleming |first=Mike |url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/05/megan-foxs-t3-replacement-down-to-three-candidates-one-front-runner/ |title=Megan Foxâs âT3? Replacement Down To Three Candidates, One Front-Runner â |publisher=Deadline.com |date=2010-05-25 |accessdate=2011-02-17}}</ref>
Decker won ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]'' magazine's 2010 "Sexiest Woman Alive" bracket challenge.<ref name="esquire2010">[http://www.esquire.com/women/the-sexiest-woman-alive/brooklyn-decker-2010 Brooklyn Decker Is ''Your'' 2010 Sexiest Woman Alive]. ''Esquire'' magazine. Retrieved June 17, 2010.</ref>
[[MTV Networks]]' NextMovie.com named her one of the 'Breakout Stars to Watch for in 2011'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nextmovie.com/blog/breakout-movie-stars-of-2011/|title=25 Breakout Stars to Watch for in 2011|last=Evry|first=Max|date=5 January 2011|publisher=Next Movie|accessdate=10 April 2011}}</ref>
Brooklyn is the female lead, Sam, in the upcoming [[Battleship (film)|Battleship]] movie based on the [[Battleship (game)|game of the same name]].
Brooklyn is playing a female lead named Skyler who is the young wife of Dennis Quaid's character, Ramsey, who finds out she is pregnant with twins in, the upcoming [[What to Expect When You're Expecting (film)|What to Expect When You're Expecting]] movie based on the book of the same name. <ref>http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1586265/</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.musicrooms.net/movies/37733-dennis-quaid-to-star-opposite-brooklyn-decker-in-new-rom-com.html |title=Dennis Quaid to star opposite Brooklyn Decker in new rom-com |publisher=Musicrooms.net |date=2011-07-20 |accessdate=2011-10-24}}</ref>
==Personal life== Decker is married to American tennis player [[Andy Roddick]].<ref>"The WAGS of the U.S. Open". ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'' magazine. September 2010. page 38</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Triggs |first=Charlotte |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20273332,00.html |title=Andy Roddick and Brooklyn Decker Tie the Knot â Weddings, Andy Roddick, Elton John |work=People |date=April 17, 2009 |accessdate=February 17, 2011}}</ref>
